Posted By: LordRandomness (8/19/2012 10:42:24 PM)

posts.post_content: Madness 0, pay 1 to cast, two for its ability to make it 3/3! Perfect. Okay making a numbers themed deck with this as #1, [Kavu Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kavu Titan) as the 2/2 for two (or the 5/5 for 5), [Cathodion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathodion), the 3/3 for three that grants you three mana, [Rosheen Meanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rosheen Meanderer), 4/4 for 4 with a 4 to mana pool ability, [Cromat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cromat), 5/5 for 5 with five abilities,[Vorosh, the Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorosh, the Hunter) 6/6 for 6 that gets six counters, [Elderscale Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elderscale Wurm) and [Lorthos, the Tidemaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lorthos, the Tidemaker) are the obvious 7s and 8s, then [Grozoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grozoth), [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus), and finally [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), [Phyrexian Dreadnought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Dreadnought) and [Withengar Unbound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Withengar Unbound)
posts.html:
Madness 0, pay 1 to cast, two for its ability to make it 3/3! Perfect. Okay making a numbers themed deck with this as #1, Kavu Titan as the 2/2 for two (or the 5/5 for 5), Cathodion, the 3/3 for three that grants you three mana, Rosheen Meanderer, 4/4 for 4 with a 4 to mana pool ability, Cromat, 5/5 for 5 with five abilities,Vorosh, the Hunter 6/6 for 6 that gets six counters, Elderscale Wurm and Lorthos, the Tidemaker are the obvious 7s and 8s, then Grozoth, Progenitus, and finally Darksteel Colossus, Phyrexian Dreadnought and Withengar Unbound
